p: Clinical evidence. Plantago lanceolata has not been trialed clinically for respiratory tract disorders. However, there is some evidence in the literature for the traditional internal use of P. lanceolata as a mucilage in the treatment of irritations of oral and pharyngeal mucosa and associated dry cough ( Wegener and Kraft, 1999). However, data on this clinical assay are scarce. Overall, the clinical evidence is Low.
